description: This API is no longer supported and will eventually be removed. We recommend you use  ListClusters,  DescribeCluster,  ListSteps,  ListInstanceGroups and  ListBootstrapActions instead. DescribeJobFlows returns a list of job flows that match all of the supplied parameters. The parameters can include a list of job flow IDs, job flow states, and restrictions on job flow creation date and time. Regardless of supplied parameters, only job flows created within the last two months are returned. If no parameters are supplied, then job flows matching either of the following criteria are returned: Amazon EMR can return a maximum of 512 job flow descriptions.

parameters.name: JobFlowIds
parameters.description: Return only job flows whose job flow ID is contained in this list. (string) ---

parameters.name: JobFlowStates
parameters.description: Return only job flows whose state is contained in this list. (string) --- The type of instance.

nested_items.name: JobFlows
nested_items.description: A list of job flows matching the parameters supplied.

nested_items.name: JobFlowId
nested_items.description: The job flow identifier.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the job flow.

nested_items.name: LogUri
nested_items.description: The location in Amazon S3 where log files for the job are stored.

nested_items.name: LogEncryptionKmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The KMS key used for encrypting log files. This attribute is only available with Amazon EMR 5.30.0 and later, excluding 6.0.0.

nested_items.name: AmiVersion
nested_items.description: Applies only to Amazon EMR AMI versions 3.x and 2.x. For Amazon EMR releases 4.0 and later, ReleaseLabel is used. To specify a custom AMI, use CustomAmiID.

nested_items.name: ExecutionStatusDetail
nested_items.description: Describes the execution status of the job flow.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The state of the job flow.

nested_items.name: CreationDateTime
nested_items.description: The creation date and time of the job flow.

nested_items.name: StartDateTime
nested_items.description: The start date and time of the job flow.

nested_items.name: ReadyDateTime
nested_items.description: The date and time when the job flow was ready to start running bootstrap actions.

nested_items.name: EndDateTime
nested_items.description: The completion date and time of the job flow.

nested_items.name: LastStateChangeReason
nested_items.description: Description of the job flow last changed state.

nested_items.name: Instances
nested_items.description: Describes the Amazon EC2 instances of the job flow.

nested_items.name: MasterInstanceType
nested_items.description: The Amazon EC2 master node instance type.

nested_items.name: MasterPublicDnsName
nested_items.description: The DNS name of the master node. If the cluster is on a private subnet, this is the private DNS name. On a public subnet, this is the public DNS name.

nested_items.name: MasterInstanceId
nested_items.description: The Amazon EC2 instance identifier of the master node.

nested_items.name: SlaveInstanceType
nested_items.description: The Amazon EC2 core and task node instance type.

nested_items.name: InstanceCount
nested_items.description: The number of Amazon EC2 instances in the cluster. If the value is 1, the same instance serves as both the master and core and task node. If the value is greater than 1, one instance is the master node and all others are core and task nodes.

nested_items.name: InstanceGroups
nested_items.description: Details about the instance groups in a cluster.

nested_items.name: InstanceGroupId
nested_items.description: Unique identifier for the instance group.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: Friendly name for the instance group.

nested_items.name: Market
nested_items.description: Market type of the Amazon EC2 instances used to create a cluster node.

nested_items.name: InstanceRole
nested_items.description: Instance group role in the cluster.

nested_items.name: BidPrice
nested_items.description: If specified, indicates that the instance group uses Spot Instances. This is the maximum price you are willing to pay for Spot Instances. Specify OnDemandPrice to set the amount equal to the On-Demand price, or specify an amount in USD.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: Amazon EC2 instance type.

nested_items.name: InstanceRequestCount
nested_items.description: Target number of instances to run in the instance group.

nested_items.name: InstanceRunningCount
nested_items.description: Actual count of running instances.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: State of instance group. The following values are no longer supported: STARTING, TERMINATED, and FAILED.

nested_items.name: LastStateChangeReason
nested_items.description: Details regarding the state of the instance group.

nested_items.name: CreationDateTime
nested_items.description: The date/time the instance group was created.

nested_items.name: StartDateTime
nested_items.description: The date/time the instance group was started.

nested_items.name: ReadyDateTime
nested_items.description: The date/time the instance group was available to the cluster.

nested_items.name: EndDateTime
nested_items.description: The date/time the instance group was terminated.

nested_items.name: CustomAmiId
nested_items.description: The custom AMI ID to use for the provisioned instance group.

nested_items.name: NormalizedInstanceHours
nested_items.description: An approximation of the cost of the cluster, represented in m1.small/hours. This value is increased one time for every hour that an m1.small instance runs. Larger instances are weighted more heavily, so an Amazon EC2 instance that is roughly four times more expensive would result in the normalized instance hours being increased incrementally four times. This result is only an approximation and does not reflect the actual billing rate.

nested_items.name: Ec2KeyName
nested_items.description: The name of an Amazon EC2 key pair that can be used to connect to the master node using SSH.

nested_items.name: Ec2SubnetId
nested_items.description: For clusters launched within Amazon Virtual Private Cloud, this is the identifier of the subnet where the cluster was launched.

nested_items.name: Placement
nested_items.description: The Amazon EC2 Availability Zone for the cluster.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Amazon EC2 Availability Zone for the cluster. AvailabilityZone is used for uniform instance groups, while AvailabilityZones (plural) is used for instance fleets.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZones
nested_items.description: When multiple Availability Zones are specified, Amazon EMR evaluates them and launches instances in the optimal Availability Zone. AvailabilityZones is used for instance fleets, while AvailabilityZone (singular) is used for uniform instance groups.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: KeepJobFlowAliveWhenNoSteps
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the cluster should remain available after completing all steps.

nested_items.name: TerminationProtected
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the Amazon EC2 instances in the cluster are protected from termination by API calls, user intervention, or in the event of a job-flow error.

nested_items.name: UnhealthyNodeReplacement
nested_items.description: Indicates whether Amazon EMR should gracefully replace core nodes that have degraded within the cluster.

nested_items.name: HadoopVersion
nested_items.description: The Hadoop version for the cluster.

nested_items.name: Steps
nested_items.description: A list of steps run by the job flow.

nested_items.name: StepConfig
nested_items.description: The step configuration.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the step.

nested_items.name: ActionOnFailure
nested_items.description: The action to take when the step fails. Use one of the following values:
TERMINATE_CLUSTER - Shuts down the cluster.
CANCEL_AND_WAIT - Cancels any pending steps and returns the cluster to the WAITING state.
CONTINUE - Continues to the next step in the queue.
TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW - Shuts down the cluster. TERMINATE_JOB_FLOW is provided for backward compatibility. We recommend using TERMINATE_CLUSTER instead.

nested_items.name: HadoopJarStep
nested_items.description: The JAR file used for the step.

nested_items.name: Properties
nested_items.description: A list of Java properties that are set when the step runs. You can use these properties to pass key-value pairs to your main function.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of a key-value pair.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value part of the identified key.

nested_items.name: Jar
nested_items.description: A path to a JAR file run during the step.

nested_items.name: MainClass
nested_items.description: The name of the main class in the specified Java file. If not specified, the JAR file should specify a Main-Class in its manifest file.

nested_items.name: Args
nested_items.description: A list of command line arguments passed to the JAR file's main function when executed.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ExecutionStatusDetail
nested_items.description: The description of the step status.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The state of the step.

nested_items.name: CreationDateTime
nested_items.description: The creation date and time of the step.

nested_items.name: StartDateTime
nested_items.description: The start date and time of the step.

nested_items.name: EndDateTime
nested_items.description: The completion date and time of the step.

nested_items.name: LastStateChangeReason
nested_items.description: A description of the step's current state.

nested_items.name: BootstrapActions
nested_items.description: A list of the bootstrap actions run by the job flow.

nested_items.name: BootstrapActionConfig
nested_items.description: A description of the bootstrap action.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the bootstrap action.

nested_items.name: ScriptBootstrapAction
nested_items.description: The script run by the bootstrap action.

nested_items.name: Path
nested_items.description: Location in Amazon S3 of the script to run during a bootstrap action.

nested_items.name: Args
nested_items.description: A list of command line arguments to pass to the bootstrap action script.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SupportedProducts
nested_items.description: A list of strings set by third-party software when the job flow is launched. If you are not using third-party software to manage the job flow, this value is empty.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: VisibleToAllUsers
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the cluster is visible to IAM principals in the Amazon Web Services account associated with the cluster. When true, IAM principals in the Amazon Web Services account can perform Amazon EMR cluster actions that their IAM policies allow. When false, only the IAM principal that created the cluster and the Amazon Web Services account root user can perform Amazon EMR actions, regardless of IAM permissions policies attached to other IAM principals.

nested_items.name: JobFlowRole
nested_items.description: The IAM role that was specified when the job flow was launched. The Amazon EC2 instances of the job flow assume this role.

nested_items.name: ServiceRole
nested_items.description: The IAM role that is assumed by the Amazon EMR service to access Amazon Web Services resources on your behalf.

nested_items.name: AutoScalingRole
nested_items.description: An IAM role for automatic scaling policies. The default role is EMR_AutoScaling_DefaultRole. The IAM role provides a way for the automatic scaling feature to get the required permissions it needs to launch and terminate Amazon EC2 instances in an instance group.

nested_items.name: ScaleDownBehavior
nested_items.description: The way that individual Amazon EC2 instances terminate when an automatic scale-in activity occurs or an instance group is resized. TERMINATE_AT_INSTANCE_HOUR indicates that Amazon EMR terminates nodes at the instance-hour boundary, regardless of when the request to terminate the instance was submitted. This option is only available with Amazon EMR 5.1.0 and later and is the default for clusters created using that version. TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION indicates that Amazon EMR adds nodes to a deny list and drains tasks from nodes before terminating the Amazon EC2 instances, regardless of the instance-hour boundary. With either behavior, Amazon EMR removes the least active nodes first and blocks instance termination if it could lead to HDFS corruption. TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION available only in Amazon EMR releases 4.1.0 and later, and is the default for releases of Amazon EMR earlier than 5.1.0.
